list-item.p: Implementation at the appropriate level of the health system to assess needs, user-friendliness, feasibility of application, and training requirements;
Refinement and adjustment for general use;
Evaluation of the effectiveness at impacting transmission via early response and cost effectiveness in support of country adoption;
Extension of the EWARS to include additional alarm indicators, particularly qualitative variables, in an alert algorithm, using decision trees and variable weighting;
Integration of Zika and chikungunya into the alert tool as historic data accumulate;
Scaling up implementation in current and new countries;
Strengthening in-country capacity and ensuring sustainability.
